issues.name: Fridge not cooling at all
symptoms: light may be on but no cooling
sounds: or occasional click and then silence
causes: no power or power outlet issue
checks: Verify the fridge is plugged in and outlet works
Check home breaker/fuse for that outlet
Listen at the back for any compressor or fan noise
Feel if the compressor is warm or completely cold
Check if control panel or temperature display is working
recommended_actions: Make sure outlet has power (test with another device)
Power cycle the fridge (unplug 5 minutes then plug back)
If compressor only clicks and stops, relay/overload may be faulty
If compressor is hot and not running, stop using and call a technician

issues.name: Weak cooling in both fridge and freezer
symptoms: freezer soft or not fully freezing
sounds: normal humming most of the time
checks: Inspect and clean condenser coils
Ensure there is enough space around the back and sides
Check if condenser fan at the back is spinning freely
Look for frost or ice buildup on freezer back wall
Check gasket condition and if doors shut fully
recommended_actions: Thoroughly clean coils with brush and vacuum
Move fridge a bit away from wall to improve airflow
Make sure fans spin freely and are not blocked by dust
If problem continues after cleaning, a technician should check refrigerant levels

issues.name: Freezer cold but fridge warm
symptoms: ice melts slowly in fridge section
back wall of freezer may be icy
sounds: evaporator fan may be noisy or quiet
airflow sound may be weak to fridge
causes: evaporator fan not blowing air to fridge
air vents between freezer and fridge blocked by ice or food
frost buildup on evaporator coils blocking airflow
checks: Open freezer and listen if fan runs when door switch is pressed
Check for ice buildup on back wall inside freezer
Look for air vents between freezer and fridge and see if blocked
Verify fridge is not over-packed blocking internal airflow
recommended_actions: Defrost fridge completely (24 hours unplugged with doors open) if heavy ice is present
Move items away from vents to allow air circulation
If fan is not spinning or makes grinding noises, fan motor may need replacement
If problem returns quickly after defrost, there may be a defrost system fault

issues.name: Fridge runs constantly without stopping
symptoms: sides of fridge may feel warm
inside possibly too cold or just barely correct
sounds: fans running most of the time
causes: broken door gasket letting warm air in
checks: Verify temperature settings are reasonable (3–4 °C / 37–40 °F for fridge)
Check gaskets for cracks or gaps and test with paper strip
Look for ice buildup or heavy load inside fridge
Inspect and clean condenser coils
Check if doors are misaligned or not closing fully
recommended_actions: Adjust temperature settings to normal range
Clean coils to reduce compressor load
Fix or replace gaskets that do not seal properly
Reduce unnecessary door opening and large warm food loads
If still running nonstop, have a technician check controls and refrigerant

issues.name: Fridge short-cycling (turns on and off quickly)
symptoms: clicking sounds every few seconds or minutes
lights work but cooling is inconsistent
sounds: click, hum for a moment, then click off
checks: Listen carefully at back for pattern of click–hum–click
Check if compressor gets very hot to the touch
Ensure fridge is plugged into a stable power outlet (not overloaded strip)
Look for burned marks on relay area (for technicians only)
recommended_actions: Unplug fridge and let compressor cool down
Avoid using cheap extension cords or overloaded power strips
If clicking repeats after cooling, relay or compressor likely needs professional service
Do not bypass safety components

issues.name: Fridge has no power at all
causes: internal fuse or control board issue
checks: Test outlet with another device (like a lamp)
Check home breaker/fuse box for tripped breaker
Inspect power cord for visible damage or burn marks
Make sure plug is fully seated and not loose
recommended_actions: Restore power at breaker if tripped
Try a different outlet temporarily if safe
If outlet works but fridge stays dead, internal electronics need service
Do not open control board unless you are qualified

issues.name: Light is on but fridge not running
sounds: complete silence except for door switch click
maybe occasional single click from compressor area
checks: Set temperature to colder and wait a few minutes
Listen carefully at the back for any attempt of compressor to start
Check if fan in freezer runs at all
Observe if compressor vibrates slightly when calling for cooling
recommended_actions: Try unplugging for 5–10 minutes to reset electronics
If compressor never attempts to start, relay/control likely faulty
If compressor tries but fails with clicking, technician should test relay and compressor

issues.name: Repeated clicking sound from back
symptoms: clicking every few seconds or minutes
compressor may start briefly then stop
sounds: short hum followed by click off
checks: Listen from the back to confirm the pattern
Check if compressor is very hot to the touch (be careful)
Observe if fans run normally while compressor fails
recommended_actions: Unplug fridge to let compressor cool
Do not keep letting it click for hours (may cause damage)
Have a technician test relay and compressor windings
Relay replacement is sometimes enough, but compressor failure is also possible

issues.name: Loud humming or buzzing noise
symptoms: vibration may be felt on sides or floor
noise may change when door is opened
sounds: buzzing from coils or metal parts touching
causes: fridge not level or touching wall/furniture
compressor older and noisier but still working
checks: Gently pull fridge away from the wall
Check if noise changes when you press on side panels
Verify if fridge is level using a small level or by feel
Listen if noise comes more from fan area or compressor
recommended_actions: Adjust fridge feet to make it level and stable
Ensure no back panel or tubing is touching wall tightly
If noise is clearly from a fan, fan motor may need replacement
If compressor is extremely loud and hot, plan for service or replacement

issues.name: Rattling, clanking, or metal vibration noise
symptoms: noise may appear when compressor starts or stops
fridge may be touching cabinets or floor unevenly
causes: loose drip tray or panel at the back
tubing touching each other or cabinet
items on top of fridge vibrating
checks: Remove items from top of fridge and test noise
Look behind fridge for loose drip pan or panel
Gently move tubing so it does not touch sharp corners
Check inside if fan cover is loose
recommended_actions: Secure any loose back panels or trays
Re-route tubes slightly to avoid contact
Keep top of fridge clear of heavy vibrating items
If internal components are loose, technician can tighten mounts

issues.name: Water leaking on floor in front of fridge
symptoms: puddle of water in front or under fridge
causes: leak from water line to ice maker or dispenser
door left slightly open causing excess condensation
checks: Check behind and under fridge for source of water
Inspect water line connections if fridge has ice maker / dispenser
Look inside freezer for ice sheet under bottom tray
Check if defrost drain hole is blocked with ice or food
recommended_actions: Turn off water supply and fix any loose water line connections
Defrost and clear defrost drain with warm water (if accessible)
Ensure doors close fully and gaskets seal properly
If leak source is internal and hidden, technician should inspect

issues.name: Water pooling inside fridge section
checks: Look under drawers for standing water
Inspect back wall for signs of water trails
Check if drain hole is blocked by debris or ice
recommended_actions: Clear drain hole using warm water and a small flexible tube
Avoid leaving door open for long periods
Keep food from touching back wall to reduce condensation

issues.name: Ice buildup on back wall of freezer
symptoms: thick ice on inside back panel
freezer may be cold but fridge warm
fan may be noisy or blocked by ice
causes: defrost timer or control board issue
door gasket leaking moist air inside
checks: Visually inspect back panel for solid ice buildup
Listen if fan noise changes or hits ice
Check door gasket for gaps or tears
Note if problem returns quickly after manual defrost
recommended_actions: Perform full manual defrost (24 hours unplugged with towels)
After defrost, monitor how long it takes for ice to return
If ice returns within days, defrost system likely needs service
Technician can test heater, thermostat, and control board

issues.name: Excess frost on food and packages
sounds: sometimes more fan noise due to airflow obstruction
causes: door not closing fully or gasket leaking
checks: Inspect door gasket for tears or dirt
Check if door is sometimes left slightly open
Verify temperature not set excessively low
Observe user habits (door frequently opened, hot food placed inside)
recommended_actions: Clean and inspect gaskets, replace if damaged
Reduce door opening time and frequency
Let hot food cool slightly before placing inside
Set temperature to manufacturer’s recommended setting

issues.name: Ice maker not producing ice
symptoms: ice maker tray may be empty
water dispenser may still work or not
sounds: sometimes small motor noise trying to rotate
causes: water supply to ice maker blocked or turned off
ice maker arm left in OFF position
checks: Confirm water supply valve is open
Check if ice maker switch/arm is in ON position
Inspect fill tube for ice blockage
Test water dispenser to confirm water pressure
recommended_actions: Thaw frozen fill tube carefully with warm (not boiling) water
Ensure house water valve is fully open
If water reaches ice maker but no cycles happen, ice maker assembly may need replacement

issues.name: Water dispenser not dispensing
symptoms: no water when pressing dispenser paddle
light may come on but no flow
ice maker may or may not work
sounds: very faint or no valve click
checks: Check if ice maker still gets water
Inspect and possibly replace water filter
Make sure water supply valve is open
Listen for valve click when pressing paddle
recommended_actions: Replace water filter if old or clogged
Thaw frozen door water line by opening door and letting it warm a bit
If valve never clicks, dispenser switch or valve may need service

issues.name: Bad odor inside fridge
symptoms: smell remains even after removing spoiled food
odor may be worse when door first opens
causes: spills under drawers or in hidden corners
clogged drain pan with organic residue
checks: Inspect all containers and drawers for spills
Remove drawers and clean underneath
Check drain pan under fridge if accessible
Inspect door gaskets for trapped food
recommended_actions: Deep clean interior with mild detergent and baking soda solution
Clean or replace any smelly containers
Ventilate fridge by leaving door open briefly (while unplugged during cleaning)
If odor persists from insulation area, professional help may be needed

issues.name: Door not closing or popping open
symptoms: door opens by itself after closing
sounds: sometimes small pop when door opens itself
causes: shelves or big items interfering with door
checks: Check if fridge leans forward (doors prefer slight backward tilt)
Inspect hinges for looseness
Make sure food items and trays do not push against door
Examine gasket for flat or cracked sections
recommended_actions: Adjust leveling feet so front is slightly higher than back
Rearrange shelves and large items
Tighten hinge screws if safe to do so
Replace gasket if it no longer seals properly

issues.name: Door gasket damaged or leaking
symptoms: visible cracks or tears in gasket
warm air leaks causing frost or weak cooling
causes: physical damage from items or children hanging on door
checks: Visually inspect gasket all around
Use paper strip test to see if gasket grips paper
Look for mold or sticky buildup on gasket
recommended_actions: Clean gasket with mild soapy water
If gasket is cracked or hard, replace it
Ensure door is correctly aligned before installing new gasket

issues.name: Temperature fluctuates widely
symptoms: sometimes very cold, sometimes too warm
ice cream may soften then refreeze
sounds: fans may turn on and off frequently
checks: Use a separate thermometer to verify actual temperatures
Inspect vents for blockages by food packages
Note whether fluctuations follow large grocery loads
Observe control panel for error codes or flickering
recommended_actions: Keep vents clear for steady airflow
Avoid placing hot food directly inside
If control panel behaves erratically, electronics may need service
Sensor replacement may be required if readings are inaccurate

issues.name: Control panel not responding or dead
sounds: normal compressor and fan sounds or no cooling if control fully failed
causes: moisture or condensation in control panel
checks: Try unplugging fridge for 5–10 minutes and plugging back in
Observe if display resets or remains frozen
Note if any error codes briefly appear
recommended_actions: Perform power reset as first step
If still unresponsive, control board or UI may need replacement
Use surge protection for sensitive electronics in future

issues.name: Error code displayed on fridge panel
sounds: otherwise normal or abnormal operation depending on error
checks: Note exact error code on display
Check user manual or manufacturer website for code meaning
Observe if cooling is affected or just display
recommended_actions: Try a power reset and see if code returns
If code persists, follow manufacturer guidance for that specific code
Technician may read advanced diagnostics for hidden codes

issues.name: Burnt smell or electrical odor
symptoms: burnt or plastic smell near fridge
possibly some discoloration on plug or cord
checks: Unplug fridge immediately if burnt smell is strong
Inspect plug and outlet for scorch marks
Do not continue using if any melting or burning is visible
recommended_actions: Keep fridge unplugged until inspected by qualified technician
Avoid sharing fridge outlet with heavy appliances
Replace damaged cords/outlets only by professionals

issues.name: Side panels excessively hot
symptoms: sides of fridge very warm or almost hot
front edge mullion hot to touch
fridge may still cool but works hard
sounds: fans may be louder than normal
causes: normal heat dissipation but exaggerated by poor airflow
checks: Check airflow behind and around fridge
Inspect and clean condenser coils
Confirm condenser fan is spinning
Measure room temperature (very hot kitchens make this worse)
recommended_actions: Improve ventilation space around fridge
Thoroughly clean coils and fan area
If fan is not running, have it repaired promptly
If heat is extreme, unplug and call a technician

issues.name: Condensation on outside surfaces
symptoms: water beads on outer walls or door
causes: energy saver or mullion heater turned off (on some models)
checks: Check humidity and ventilation in the kitchen
Inspect gasket for leaks
Note if condensation worse during humid weather
recommended_actions: Improve room ventilation and reduce humidity if possible
Ensure doors seal fully
Turn on anti-condensation or mullion heater function if available
Wipe moisture regularly to avoid floor damage

issues.name: Loud bang or knock when compressor starts or stops
symptoms: single loud knock at start or stop
noise may scare users but brief
causes: tubing or panels flexing with pressure changes
checks: Verify noise is a single event at start/stop, not continuous
Check if fridge is level and stable
Listen from different sides to locate source
recommended_actions: Ensure fridge is level and not rocking
If cooling is normal and noise is brief, often considered a normal characteristic on some models
If noise becomes very loud or frequent, technician can inspect mounts and compressor
